stories.title: On-Chain, the Emperor Wears No Clothes
China’s Weapon Test Close to a ‘Sputnik Moment,’ U.S. General Says

How Josh Simons launched Vampr and grew it to 1.1M users
Byrne Hobart on the Financialisation of Everything

stories.text:
Is that time of the year when I have to buy my landlord's kids presents in exchange for him buying me Romanian unhealty food and booze :)

The youngest one, about 11, seems to like robots/computers. I want to get him a starting programming kit of sorts. Myself I started with a ZX Spectrum clone, that came with a booklet with some stuff I could do with the computer. So I was thinking to get him something like a RPI with a keyboard and preinstalled dev environment he can play with. Anything like that?

I don't have lots of time atm to do it myself, thus I'm looking for an already made solution.
stories.title: Ask HN: Starting kit for an aspiring software developer
